title: Prayer for International Women's Day, by Rabbi Lior Bar-Ami
author: Lior Bar-Ami

coauthors.name: Lior Bar-Ami
coauthors.bio: Rabbi Lior Bar-Ami is a Reform/Liberal movement rabbi in Europe. He was ordained at Abraham-Geiger-College in Berlin, Germany in 2016. Rabbi Bar-Ami has served as rabbi for The Liberal Synagogue in Toulouse, France and Or Chadash Synagogue in Vienna, Austria.

excerpt: This prayer for International Women's Day by Rabbi Lior Bar-Ami was first published on their Facebook page, 8 March 2024. . . .
content:
Contribute a translation Source (English)
Creator of all,
on this International Womenâ€™s Day,
we gather to celebrate
the strength and resilience of women
throughout history,
drawing inspiration
from the courageous biblical figures
who shaped our faith
and our world.
We remember Miriam, the prophetess,
who fearlessly led her people out of bondage
with song and dance.
Like Miriam, may women everywhere lead
with boldness and grace,
paving the way
for liberation and equality.
We honor the bravery of Esther,
who risked her life
to save her people from destruction.
May we, like Esther, find the courage
to speak out against injustice
and fight for the rights of all
who are oppressed.
We pay tribute to Ruth,
whose loyalty and compassion
earned her a place in the lineage of King David.
May we, like Ruth, extend kindness and empathy
to all whom we encounter,
building bridges of understanding and unity.
We lift up Deborah, the wise judge and prophetess,
who fearlessly led her people into battle.
May women everywhere rise
to positions of leadership and influence,
using their voices and talents
to enact positive change
in the world.
On this day, and every day, we commit ourselves
to honoring the contributions of women,
both past and present,
and to working towards a future
where all are treated with dignity,
respect,
and equality.

This prayer for International Women’s Day by Rabbi Lior Bar-Ami was first published on their Facebook page, 8 March 2024.
